title: Keep Your Pets Warm Indoors
description: Make sure your pets have a cozy place inside with blankets or pet beds away from drafts.

title: Use Pet Sweaters
description: Dress your pets in warm sweaters or coats, especially small or short-haired breeds.

title: Limit Outdoor Time
description: Reduce the time your pets spend outside in cold weather to prevent hypothermia.

title: Protect Paws from Ice and Salt
description: Use pet booties or paw balm to protect their paws from ice, salt, and frostbite.

title: Check for Frostbite
description: Examine ears, tails, and paws regularly for signs of frostbite or cold injury.

title: Keep Pets Hydrated
description: Provide fresh water daily as pets can get dehydrated even in winter.

title: Adjust Diet if Needed
description: Consult your vet about adding extra calories if your pet is more active outside.

title: Provide Heated Beds
description: Use heated pads or beds for elderly or sick pets to keep them warm.

title: Grooming in Winter
description: Keep fur clean and brushed, but don’t shave pets too short during winter.

title: Be Careful on Ice
description: Supervise pets on icy surfaces to prevent slips and injuries.

title: Keep Them Active Indoors
description: Provide toys and playtime inside to maintain physical and mental health.

title: Regular Vet Checkups
description: Winter stress can affect pets’ health, so regular checkups are important.
